NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He aimed at the target.

NewWords.WordPhrase: take a bold decisive step, esp. after thinking about it for some time（尤指经过一番思考后）采取断然行动
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He took the plunge by investing all his savings in the stock market.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. (derog) always ready to quarrel or attack; threatening 爱挑衅的，好斗的；侵略的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They were drunk, aggressive and looking for a fight.

NewWords.WordPhrase: to the advantage of sb. 对某人有利
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The protection that farmers have enjoyed amounts to a bias in favor of the countryside.

NewWords.WordPhrase: move towards (a place) 向（某处）行进
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. These people are heading for the city hall.
e.g. When does the next train depart?

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. provide evidence for the truth of; establish the truth of 证实；确认
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Please confirm your telephone message by writing to me.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (usu. pl.) condition or fact connected with another event or action 环境；情形；情况   in/under the/no circumstances 在这种情况下／在任何情况下决不
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Maybe under these circumstances we may say that man can conquer nature.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. speak in favor of; support 主张；提倡
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Our premier advocates higher salaries for teachers.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. come to believe (sth.) as a result of reasoning; reach a decision; bring to an end 断定，得出结论；决定；结束
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The doctor concluded that the patient's disease was cancer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. (AmE) make sure; guarantee 确保；保证
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Carefulness insures you against errors.
e.g. We can count on Lisa to keep her promise.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make a favorable judgment of 推荐
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Can you recommend a good dictionary?

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the force of one object hitting another 冲击力
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Under the impact of the waves, rocks along the coast have lost their edges.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. anything fired at in shooting practice 靶；目标
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The hunter's target was a wild animal.

NewWords.Word: draw the line at sth./doing sth.
NewWords.WordPhrase: refuse to do or refuse to tolerate sth. 拒绝做某事；决不容忍某事
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The criminal declared that he would draw the line at hitting an old lady.

NewWords.WordPhrase: enter by force 强行进入
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The burglar broke in and stole my money.
e.g. He wouldn't put his career on the line to help a friend.
